title: CycloneDX Formulation Model
$comment: OWASP CycloneDX is an Ecma International standard (ECMA-424) developed in collaboration between the OWASP Foundation and Ecma Technical Committee 54 (TC54). The standard is published under a royalty-free patent policy. This JSON schema is the reference implementation and is licensed under the Apache License 2.0.

formulation.title: Formulation
formulation.description: Describes the formulation of any referencable object within the BOM, including components, services, metadata, declarations, or the BOM itself. This may encompass how the object was created, assembled, deployed, tested, certified, or otherwise brought into its present form. Common examples include software build pipelines, deployment processes, AI/ML model training, cryptographic key generation or certification, and third-party audits. Processes are modeled using declared and observed formulas, composed of workflows, tasks, and individual steps.

formula.title: Formula
formula.description: Describes workflows and resources that captures rules and other aspects of how the associated BOM component or service was formed.

bom-ref.title: BOM Reference
bom-ref.description:
An identifier which can be used to reference the formula elsewhere in the BOM. Every `bom-ref` must be unique within the BOM.
Value SHOULD not start with the BOM-Link intro 'urn:cdx:' to avoid conflicts with BOM-Links.

components.title: Components
components.description: Transient components that are used in tasks that constitute one or more of this formula's workflows

services.title: Services
services.description: Transient services that are used in tasks that constitute one or more of this formula's workflows

workflows.title: Workflows
workflows.description: List of workflows that can be declared to accomplish specific orchestrated goals and independently triggered.
workflows.$comment: Different workflows can be designed to work together to perform end-to-end CI/CD builds and deployments.

workflow.title: Workflow
workflow.$comment: Workflow are as task themselves and can trigger other workflow tasks.  These relationships can be modeled in the taskDependencies graph.

bom-ref.title: BOM Reference
bom-ref.description:
An identifier which can be used to reference the workflow elsewhere in the BOM. Every `bom-ref` must be unique within the BOM.
Value SHOULD not start with the BOM-Link intro 'urn:cdx:' to avoid conflicts with BOM-Links.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the resource instance.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the resource instance.

resourceReferences.title: Resource references
resourceReferences.description: References to component or service resources that are used to realize the resource instance.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.description: The tasks that comprise the workflow.
tasks.$comment: Note that tasks can appear more than once as different instances (by name or UID).

taskDependencies.title: Task dependency graph
taskDependencies.description: The graph of dependencies between tasks within the workflow.

taskTypes.title: Task types
taskTypes.description: Indicates the types of activities performed by the set of workflow tasks.
taskTypes.$comment: Currently, these types reflect common CI/CD actions.

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.description: The trigger that initiated the task.

steps.title: Steps
steps.description: The sequence of steps for the task.

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: Represents resources and data brought into a task at runtime by executor or task commands
examples: a `configuration` file which was declared as a local `component` or `externalReference`

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: Represents resources and data output from a task at runtime by executor or task commands
examples: a log file or metrics data produced by the task

timeStart.title: Time start
timeStart.description: The date and time (timestamp) when the task started.

timeEnd.title: Time end
timeEnd.description: The date and time (timestamp) when the task ended.

workspaces.title: Workspaces
workspaces.description: A set of named filesystem or data resource shareable by workflow tasks.

runtimeTopology.$comment: A description of the runtime component and service topology.  This can describe a partial or complete topology used to host and execute the task (e.g., hardware, operating systems, configurations, etc.),

task.description: Describes the inputs, sequence of steps and resources used to accomplish a task and its output.
task.$comment: Tasks are building blocks for constructing assemble CI/CD workflows or pipelines.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the resource instance.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.description: The names for the workspace as referenced by other workflow tasks. Effectively, a name mapping so other tasks can use their own local name in their steps.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the resource instance.

resourceReferences.title: Resource references
resourceReferences.description: References to component or service resources that are used to realize the resource instance.

accessMode.title: Access mode
accessMode.description: Describes the read-write access control for the workspace relative to the owning resource instance.

mountPath.title: Mount path
mountPath.description: A path to a location on disk where the workspace will be available to the associated task's steps.

managedDataType.title: Managed data type
managedDataType.description: The name of a domain-specific data type the workspace represents.
managedDataType.$comment: This property is for CI/CD frameworks that are able to provide access to structured, managed data at a more granular level than a filesystem.

volumeRequest.title: Volume request
volumeRequest.description: Identifies the reference to the request for a specific volume type and parameters.
examples: a kubernetes Persistent Volume Claim (PVC) name

volume.title: Volume
volume.description: Information about the actual volume instance allocated to the workspace.
volume.$comment: The actual volume allocated may be different than the request.

volume.title: Volume
volume.description: An identifiable, logical unit of data storage tied to a physical device.

uid.title: Unique Identifier (UID)
uid.description: The unique identifier for the volume instance within its deployment context.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the volume instance

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: The mode for the volume instance.

path.title: Path
path.description: The underlying path created from the actual volume.

sizeAllocated.title: Size allocated
sizeAllocated.description: The allocated size of the volume accessible to the associated workspace. This should include the scalar size as well as IEC standard unit in either decimal or binary form.

persistent.title: Persistent
persistent.description: Indicates if the volume persists beyond the life of the resource it is associated with.

remote.title: Remote
remote.description: Indicates if the volume is remotely (i.e., network) attached.

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.description: Represents a resource that can conditionally activate (or fire) tasks based upon associated events and their data.

bom-ref.description:
An identifier which can be used to reference the trigger elsewhere in the BOM. Every `bom-ref` must be unique within the BOM.
Value SHOULD not start with the BOM-Link intro 'urn:cdx:' to avoid conflicts with BOM-Links.

event.description: The event data that caused the associated trigger to activate.

timeActivated.title: Time activated

examples: a log file or metrics data produced by the task

event.title: Event
event.description: Represents something that happened that may trigger a response.

uid.title: Unique Identifier (UID)
uid.description: The unique identifier of the event.

timeReceived.title: Time Received
timeReceived.description: The date and time (timestamp) when the event was received.

data.title: Data
data.description: Encoding of the raw event data.

source.title: Source
source.description: References the component or service that was the source of the event

target.title: Target
target.description: References the component or service that was the target of the event

inputType.title: Input type
inputType.description: Type that represents various input data types and formats.

source.title: Source
source.description: A reference to the component or service that provided the input to the task (e.g., reference to a service with data flow value of `inbound`)

target.title: Target
target.description: A reference to the component or service that received or stored the input if not the task itself (e.g., a local, named storage workspace)

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: A reference to an independent resource provided as an input to a task by the workflow runtime.
examples: a reference to a configuration file in a repository (i.e., a bom-ref)
a reference to a scanning service used in a task (i.e., a bom-ref)

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Inputs that have the form of parameters with names and values.

environmentVars.title: Environment variables
environmentVars.description: Inputs that have the form of parameters with names and values.

oneOf.title: String-Based Environment Variables
oneOf.description: In addition to the more common key–value pair format, some environment variables may consist of a single string without an explicit value assignment. These string-based environment variables typically act as flags or signals to software, indicating that a feature should be enabled, a mode should be activated, or a specific condition is present. Their presence alone conveys meaning.

data.title: Data
data.description: Inputs that have the form of data.

type.title: Type
type.description: Describes the type of data output.

source.title: Source
source.description: Component or service that generated or provided the output from the task (e.g., a build tool)

target.title: Target
target.description: Component or service that received the output from the task (e.g., reference to an artifactory service with data flow value of `outbound`)
examples: a log file described as an `externalReference` within its target domain.

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: A reference to an independent resource generated as output by the task.

data.title: Data
data.description: Outputs that have the form of data.

environmentVars.title: Environment variables
environmentVars.description: Outputs that have the form of environment variables.

oneOf.title: String-Based Environment Variables
oneOf.description: In addition to the more common key–value pair format, some environment variables may consist of a single string without an explicit value assignment. These string-based environment variables typically act as flags or signals to software, indicating that a feature should be enabled, a mode should be activated, or a specific condition is present. Their presence alone conveys meaning.

resourceReferenceChoice.title: Resource reference choice
resourceReferenceChoice.description: A reference to a locally defined resource (e.g., a bom-ref) or an externally accessible resource.
resourceReferenceChoice.$comment: Enables reference to a resource that participates in a workflow; using either internal (bom-ref) or external (externalReference) types.

ref.title: BOM Reference
ref.description: References an object by its bom-ref attribute

externalReference.title: External reference
externalReference.description: Reference to an externally accessible resource.

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: A condition that was used to determine a trigger should be activated.

description.title: Description
description.description: Describes the set of conditions which cause the trigger to activate.

expression.title: Expression
expression.description: The logical expression that was evaluated that determined the trigger should be fired.

meta:enum.copy: A task that copies software or data used to accomplish other tasks in the workflow.
meta:enum.clone: A task that clones a software repository into the workflow in order to retrieve its source code or data for use in a build step.
meta:enum.lint: A task that checks source code for programmatic and stylistic errors.
meta:enum.scan: A task that performs a scan against source code, or built or deployed components and services. Scans are typically run to gather or test for security vulnerabilities or policy compliance.
meta:enum.merge: A task that merges changes or fixes into source code prior to a build step in the workflow.
meta:enum.build: A task that builds the source code, dependencies and/or data into an artifact that can be deployed to and executed on target systems.
meta:enum.test: A task that verifies the functionality of a component or service.
meta:enum.deliver: A task that delivers a built artifact to one or more target repositories or storage systems.
meta:enum.deploy: A task that deploys a built artifact for execution on one or more target systems.
meta:enum.release: A task that releases a built, versioned artifact to a target repository or distribution system.
meta:enum.clean: A task that cleans unnecessary tools, build artifacts and/or data from workflow storage.
meta:enum.other: A workflow task that does not match current task type definitions.

parameter.title: Parameter
parameter.description: A representation of a functional parameter.

dataType.title: Data type
dataType.description: The data type of the parameter.
